channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Diane Keaton, Oscar-winning star of 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather,' dies at 79
item.description: The actor, known for her quirky, vibrant manner and depth was 79. Across her decades-long career, she worked with prominent filmmakers including Francis Ford Coppola, Woody Allen and Nancy Meyers.
item.content:encoded:
The actor, known for her quirky, vibrant manner and depth was 79. Across her decades-long career, she worked with prominent filmmakers including Francis Ford Coppola, Woody Allen and Nancy Meyers.

(Image credit: Chris Pizzello/Invision)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump slashes mental health agency as shutdown drags on
item.description: Sources tell NPR that more than 100 employees have been laid off at the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Agency. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention had some cuts reversed late Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
Sources tell NPR that more than 100 employees have been laid off at the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Agency. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention had some cuts reversed late Saturday.

(Image credit: Smith Collection)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Nobel Prize winner Machado says Venezuela is in 'chaos' under current regime
item.description: The far-right leader of Venezuela's opposition party said that the current president is illegitimate and called for his removal.
item.content:encoded:
The far-right leader of Venezuela's opposition party said that the current president is illegitimate and called for his removal.

(Image credit: Alfredo Lasry R)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to use 'available funds' to pay military during shutdown
item.description: President Trump's announcement comes days before active duty members would have missed their first full paycheck as the shutdown of the federal government continues.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's announcement comes days before active duty members would have missed their first full paycheck as the shutdown of the federal government continues.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Smithsonian museums and National Zoo set to close as shutdown takes its toll
item.description: The shutdown is forcing the closure of a number of America's beloved cultural institutions starting Sunday. Twenty-one Smithsonian museums, its research centers and the National Zoo are all affected.
item.content:encoded:
The shutdown is forcing the closure of a number of America's beloved cultural institutions starting Sunday. Twenty-one Smithsonian museums, its research centers and the National Zoo are all affected.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: 4 dead and 12 injured in a shooting after Mississippi homecoming game
item.description: The small town of Leland, Miss., was rocked by the shooting, which took place late Friday.
item.content:encoded: The small town of Leland, Miss., was rocked by the shooting, which took place late Friday.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Africa's oldest leader isn't ready to retire — and he's not the only one defying age
item.description: At 92, Cameroon's President aul Biya is running for an eighth term on Sunday — a reminder of how Africa's aging leaders continue to cling to power, even as their nations face unrest, corruption, and calls for change.
item.content:encoded:
At 92, Cameroon's President aul Biya is running for an eighth term on Sunday — a reminder of how Africa's aging leaders continue to cling to power, even as their nations face unrest, corruption, and calls for change.

(Image credit: ‎)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Photos celebrate the glory of girls on 'International Day of the Girl'
item.description: October 11 is the "International Day of the Girl" on the United Nations calendar. These photos pay tribute to the spirit of girls in a world where they face many obstacles.
item.content:encoded:
October 11 is the "International Day of the Girl" on the United Nations calendar. These photos pay tribute to the spirit of girls in a world where they face many obstacles.

(Image credit: Danielle Villasana)
item.dc:creator: Arundathi Nair

item.title: Luigi Mangione's lawyers seek a dismissal of federal charges in CEO killing
item.description: Mangione's lawyers asked a federal judge to dismiss some criminal charges, including the only count for which he could face the death penalty, from a federal indictment brought against him.
item.content:encoded:
Mangione's lawyers asked a federal judge to dismiss some criminal charges, including the only count for which he could face the death penalty, from a federal indictment brought against him.

(Image credit: Seth Wenig)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Being your authentic self: NPR's LGBTQ+ readers share their coming out stories
item.description: National Coming Out Day is Oct. 11. To celebrate and honor LGBTQ+ people who have come out and those who want to, NPR readers share how they told their loved ones.
item.content:encoded:
National Coming Out Day is Oct. 11. To celebrate and honor LGBTQ+ people who have come out and those who want to, NPR readers share how they told their loved ones.

(Image credit: Left to right: Mel Barkalow, Winnie Aghenu, Anu Gupta and Ash Schade.)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
